thread.title: Matthew Wade Refuses To Walk Despite Clearly Edging The Ball And The Internet Is Not Taking It Too Well - Indiatimes.com
thread.title_full: Matthew Wade Refuses To Walk Despite Clearly Edging The Ball And The Internet Is Not Taking It Too Well - Indiatimes.com

title: Matthew Wade Refuses To Walk Despite Clearly Edging The Ball And The Internet Is Not Taking It Too Well - Indiatimes.com
text:
Somak Adhikari February 25, 2017 
When Matthew Wade was out on Day 3 of the Pune Test between India and Australia, it seemed routine enough. 
AFP 
The batsman nicked the ball from Umesh Yadav, Wriddhiman Saha pouched up the catch, the Indians began to celebrate. 
However, Wade stood his ground. The umpire thought he would walk off since it was a clear edge, but he did not. So the finger had to be raised and Wade was on his way. 
AFP 
Of course while it is normal for a batsman to wait for the umpire's decision, in such clear cases does the umpire need to raise his decision at all? 
Twitter was clearly not happy at the decision as fans questioned Wade's integrity. Here's what they had to say: 'Matthew Wade ka color hua fade.'As punny as one can get.Kamal ki commentary. #IndvAus â€” Bhaarat Kurda (@TheBhaaratKurda) 25 February 2017 C'mon @CricketAus .. please teach some fairplay too.. Matthew Wade knew he was out on that ball from Umesh Yadav.. #IndvAus â€” Lalit Jain (@lalit_you) 25 February 2017 @gilly381 so today ,even Matthew Wade stood his ground after getting a clear edge.are you gonna tweet about it or not ðŸ˜‘ðŸ˜‘ â€” vivek dhyani (@dhyani_vivek) 25 February 2017 Matthew Wade couldn't capitalise over breather provided by Umpire Kettleborough, gets a thicker edge this time. #KarmaBites @virendersehwag â€” Avinash Sharma (@avinashrcsharma) 25 February 2017 @gilly381 Oh dear ! Matthew Wade is such an honest player #Aussievalues #IndvAus â€” Rohit Singh (@lazyroe) 25 February 2017 Don't Miss
